intro: Koeleria lasiorhachis, commonly known as the rough-haired koeleria, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny blue to purple flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often covered with fine, bristly hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. Koeleria lasiorhachis is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
